info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 11:21PM MDT until August 1 at 2:15AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, western Mora.
* WHEN...Until 215 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1119 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over the northern portion of the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon burn scar earlier this evening. Arroyo and small stream flooding will continue. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding and elevated flow in areas creeks and streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mora, Cleveland, Holman, Ledoux, Morphy Lake State Park, La Cueva, Chacon, Gascon, Monte Aplanado and South Carmen. - This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 10 and 18. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 17 and 43. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 0 and 8. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 15. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 7 and 9. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated flows within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon burn scar.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR THE HERMITS PEAK CALF CANYON BURN SCAR IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM MDT FRIDAY
